register.description: Enet Port N IET Control

bitfield.description: Mac Preempt Queue – Indicates which transmit FIFO queues are sent to the preempt MAC. Bit 0 indicates queue zero, bit 1 queue 1 and so on. Packets will be sent to the preempt MAC only when MAC_PENABLE is set, and when MAC_VERIFIED (fromCPSW_PN_IET_STATUS_REG) or MAC_DISABLEVERIFY is set, and when IET_PORT_EN is set.
Mac Fragment Size – An integer in the range 0:7 indicating, as a multiple of 64, the minimum additional length for nonfinal mPackets. 0 = 64 1 = 128 2 = 192 3 = 256 4 = 320 5 = 384 6 = 448 7 = 512
Mac Link Fail – Link Fail Indicatior to reset the verifly state machine. This bit is reset high. Verify and response frames will be sent/allowed when this bit is cleared.

Mac Disable Verify – Disables verification on the port when set. If this bit is set then packets will be sent to the preempt Mac when MAC_PENABLE is set (This is a forced mode with no IET verification).
Mac Hold – Hold Preemption on the port.
Mac Preemption Enable – Port Preemption Enable. This takes effect only when IET_PORT_EN is set.

register.description: Enet Port N IET Status

bitfield.description: Mac Received Verify Packet with Errors – Set when a verify packet with errors is received. Cleared when MAC_PENABLE is cleared to zero.
Mac Received Respond Packet with Errors – Set when a respond packet with errors is received. Cleared when MAC_PENABLE is cleared to zero.
Mac Verification Failed – Indication that verification was unsuccessful.
Mac Verified – Indication that verification was successful.

register.description: Enet Port N IET VERIFY

bitfield.description: Mac Verify Timeout Count – The number of wireside clocks contained in the verify timeout counter. The default is 0x1312d0 (10ms at 125Mhz in gig mode).

register.description: Ethernet Port N FIFO Status Register
Ethernet Port N Enhanced Scheduled Traffic (EST) Control Register

bitfield.description: EST Prempt Comparison Value. When the count in a zero allow is less than or equal to this value in bytes (times 8), prempt packets are cleared from the wire. This is the prempt clear margin value.
EST Timestamp First Express Packet only.

bitfield.description: InterVLAN location pointer.This field points to the InterVLAN location that will be read/written by accesses to the

register.description: This register is present on SR2.0 only. Ethernet Port N Tx Egress InterVLAN A

bitfield.description: Destination Address bits 23-16 – DA byte 4 on wire.
Destination Address bits 31-24 – DA byte 3 on wire.
Destination Address bits 39-32 – DA byte 2 on wire.
Destination Address bits 47-40 – DA byte 1 on wire.

register.description: This register is present on SR2.0 only. Ethernet Port N Tx Egress InterVLAN B

bitfield.description: Source Address bits 39-32 – SA byte 2 on wire.
Source Address bits 47-40 – SA byte 1 on wire.
Destination Address bits 7-0 – DA byte 6 on wire.
Destination Address bits 15-8 – DA byte 5 on wire.

register.description: This register is present on SR2.0 only. Ethernet Port N Tx Egress InterVLAN C

bitfield.description: Source Address bits 7-0 – SA byte 6 on wire.
Source Address bits 15-8 – SA byte 5 on wire.
Source Address bits 23-16 – SA byte 4 on wire.
Source Address bits 31-24 – SA byte 3 on wire.

register.description: This register is present on SR2.0 only. Ethernet Port N Tx Egress InterVLAN D

bitfield.description: Decrement Time To Live.When set, the Time To Live (TTL) field in the header is decremented:- IPV4 – Decrement the TTL byte and update the Header Checksum- IPV6 – Decrement the Hop Limit.When this bit is cleared the TTL/Hop Limit fields are not checked or modified.
Destination VLAN Force Untagged Egress.When set, this bit indicates that the VLAN should be removed on egress for the routed packet. The

Replace Destination Address and Source Address.When set this bit indicates that the routed packet destination address should be replaced by DA[47:0] and the source address should be replaced by SA[47:0].
Replace VLAN ID. When set this bit indicates that the VLAN ID should be replaced for the routed packet.
